headline.print_headline: Judge Says He Will Lift Restrictions on Female Guards
headline.main: Judge Says He Will Lift Restrictions on Female Guantánamo Guards

snippet: In his ruling, Col. James Pohl of the Army also said he would keep the ban in place for six more months, because of “inappropriate” public criticism of it by senior military leaders.
abstract: Col James Pohl, military judge overseeing war crimes proceedings at Guantanamo Bay against Sept 11 suspects, is reported to have extended ban on women guards having contact with five men on trial; ban has been criticized by some military leaders, but lawyers defending men say it was put in place in support of Muslim beliefs held by prisoners restricting contact with unrelated women.
